property.name: $agents
property.default: array('mobile' => array('Android', 'BlackBerry', 'Blazer', 'Brew', 'IEMobile', 'iPad', 'iPhone', 'iPod', 'KDDI', 'Kindle', 'Maemo', 'MOT-', 'Nokia', 'SymbianOS', 'UP.Browser', 'UP.Link', 'Opera Mobi', 'Opera Mini', 'webOS', 'Playstation', 'PS2', 'Windows CE', 'Polaris', 'SEMC', 'NetFront', 'Fennec'), 'crawler' => array('Ask', 'Baidu', 'Google', 'AdsBot', 'gsa-crawler', 'adidxbot', 'librabot', 'llssbot', 'bingbot', 'Danger hiptop', 'MSMOBOT', 'MSNBot', 'MSR-ISRCCrawler', 'MSRBOT', 'Vancouver', 'Y!J', 'Yahoo', 'mp3Spider', 'Mp3Bot', 'Scooter', 'slurp', 'Y!OASIS', 'YRL_ODP_CRAWLER', 'Yandex', 'Fast', 'Lycos', 'heritrix', 'ia_archiver', 'InternetArchive', 'archive.org_bot', 'Nutch', 'WordPress', 'Wget'))

docblock.description: An array of http user-agents used in matching mobile browsers and crawlers
A property to hold previous calls to isMobile() so you don't have to loop through $this->agents['mobile'] again.
A property to hold previous calls to isCrawler() so you don't have to loop through $this->agents['crawler'] again.
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of global variables, typically $GLOBALS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of override agent values.

docblock.description: A page controller.
The action to perform, typically discovered from the params.
The page format to render, typically discovered from the params.
The exception caught inside `exec()`.
Initialize after construction.
Returns the action, typically discovered from the params.
Returns the page format, typically discovered from the params.
Returns the exception caught by exec().
Executes the action and all hooks:
docblock.long-description:
• signals pre_exec, thereby calling preExec()

  • signals pre_action, thereby calling preAction()

  • calls action() to find and invoke the action method

  • signals post_action, thereby calling postAction()

  • signals pre_render, thereby calling preRender()

  • calls render() to render a view (does nothing by default)

  • signals post_render, thereby calling postRender()

  • signals post_exec, thereby calling postExec()

  • signals catch_exception when a exception is thrown, thereby calling catchException()

  • returns the Response transfer object

docblock.description: Determines the action method, then invokes it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the action to invoke.

docblock.description: Invokes a method by name, matching method params to `$this->params`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method name to execute, typically an action.

docblock.description: Renders the page into the response object.
Runs at the beginning of `exec()` before `preAction()`.
Runs after `preExec()` and before the main `action()`.
Runs after the main `action()` and before `preRender()`.
Runs after `postAction()` and before `render()`.
Runs after `render()` and before `postExec()`.
Runs at the end of `exec()` after `postRender()`.
Runs when `exec()` catches an exception.
This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.

tag.description: http://opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php BSD

docblock.description: Retains information about the controller results for transfer to an actual HTTP response object.
Should the response disable browser caching?
docblock.long-description:
When false, the getHeaders() method will set these headers in its return value (note that they are not added to $headers directly):

{{code: Pragma: no-cache Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate Cache-Control: post-check=0, pre-check=0 Expires: 1 }}

When true or null, the getHeaders() method will make no changes to the existing headers.

docblock.description: The response body content.
The Content-Type of the response.
The response cookies.
Whether or not cookies should default to being sent by HTTP only.
The response headers (less the cookies).
Redirect to this location.
The response status code.
The response status text.
The HTTP version to send as.
Should the response disable HTTP caching?
docblock.long-description:
When false, the getHeaders() method will add these headers:

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate
Cache-Control: post-check=0, pre-check=0
Expires: 1

tag.name: param
tag.description: When true, disable browser caching.

docblock.description: Is caching turned off?

tag.name: return
tag.description: Note that this is a ternary: true, false, or null.

tag.description: The domain that the cookie is available on.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: When true, the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol. This means that the cookie won't be accessible by scripting languages, such as JavaScript.

tag.description: A sequential array of cookie descriptors.

docblock.description: By default, should cookies be sent by HTTP only?

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to send by HTTP only, false to send by any method.
